content.description: Climb off a platform, out of a gully onto the slab (Bolt). Work your way up a sickle shaped, shallow left facing dihedral past gear to another bolt.  Climb the beautiful right facing dihedral into a roof trending right. Climb out of the roof to the chains.
content.protection: 2 sets of camelots to #3, smallest C3s/peanuts after 1st bolt. Long runners
content.location: 50 yards left (East) of Direct Commitment is another slab that is distinguished by a crag wide roof system that guards the bottom of the slab.  Head up to the far left side of this on a platform. Look up high to locate the roof.  The trail heads over below the Commitment proper slab.

content.description: Climb to the 1st bolt until the roof forces you left.  Layback and pull a flake to a good stance. Savor the slab/arete above.
content.protection: bolts, red camelot for the top
content.location: Right most route at the crag.  The route sneaks around the crag wide roof starting on a toe of rock that extends down lower.  Look for the flake feature 15 feet up.

content.description: Ascend the center of the slab to where you can traverse into a left facing corner. Ascend this and the small roof above to the bolt at the top of pitch 4. Poor protection.
content.location: Start up & left aprox. 50' from Commitment at a grassy area beneath a smooth slab.

content.description: Aim for the seam/corner that is the obvious weakness in the crag wide roof. Angle left on knobs and dikes shooting for a hole to stand in.  Do some straight up friction until it eases off heading back right.  Look for gear and head to the chains.  Shares anchors with Involuntary Commitment.  It is also the 2nd rap for To Legit To Commit.

climbs.name: Commitment
climbs.fa: Joel Brown, Dave George and Paul Horton 1970

content.description:
P1- Climb left of the main rib to a left facing corner. Either continue up the corner or traverse right and climb the face above to a mahogany tree.

P2- Follow a corner up & right to a ledge with a large tree.

P3- Make an easy traverse left and down 30' to a stance.

P4- Follow corner above to a traverse left across a slab to belay at a bolt.

Descent: Rap or downclimb to the gully descending down from the Triangle wall.
content.location: Start at the right edge of the slab near it's lowest point.

climbs.name: Coco Puffs Direct Start
climbs.fa: Bill Robins & partner in the mid 80's

content.description:
Ascend the slab past the left side of a roof. Continue up a ways passing the right edge of 2 narrow roofs to several large pines.

Descent: Traverse right to a descent into the gully or continue up Coco Puffs(5.6).
content.location: Start Aprox. 50' left of the Direct Commitment Variation.
